snippet: A pharmacy and a nutrition company got away with overbilling the insurance program by millions of dollars thanks to connections in the Democratic Party, a Congressional committee’s letters said.
abstract: Congressional committee releases letters stating that Marra's pharmacy in Cohoes, NY, and Total Town Nutrition Inc in Manhattan overcharged Medicaid by millions of dollars by using political connections; letters, demanding release of related documents and emails, are part of broadening corruption inquiry.
lead_paragraph: A pharmacy and a nutrition company got away with overbilling the insurance program by millions of dollars thanks to connections in the Democratic Party, a Congressional committee’s letters said.

headline.main: Two Firms Accused of Using Political Ties to Bilk Medicaid
headline.print_headline: Two Firms Accused of Using Political Ties to Bilk Medicaid
